newsitem.title: INDIA: India ICICI, SCICI boards to consider merger.
newsitem.headline: India ICICI, SCICI boards to consider merger.

text.p: The boards of directors of the Industrial Credit and Investment Corporation of India Ltd (ICICI) and SCICI Ltd are meeting next Tuesday to consider the merger of the two companies, an ICICI official said on Friday.
"The ICICI and SCICI have decidied to convene meetings of their respective boards of directors on December 31 to consider a proposal for merger of both companies," the official said.
Notices of the board meetings had already been issued to the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), the country's premier bourse and other stock exchanges, a statement issued by ICICI said.
These notices were issued to comply with Indian legal requirements, the statement added.
ICICI, one of India's leading term lending financial institutions, had assets of $7.48 billion as of September 30, 1996. It ended at 58.75 rupees on the BSE on December 23.
The BSE is closed from Wednesday till December 31 for Christmas holidays.
ICICI is one of the major shareholders in SCICI, with a stake of around 20 percent.
SCICI was set up in 1986 to finance shipping and fishing industries. Over the years it has diversified and provides financial assistance to other industries.
It had assets of $1.85 billion as on September 30 and was traded at 26.25 rupees at close on Decewmber 23 on the BSE.
